text: An Oracle against Babylon
The oracle of Babylon that Isaiah son of Amoz saw:
Raise a signal on a bare hill,
lift up \add your\add* voice to them;
wave \add the\add* hand and may they enter \add the\add* gateways of \add the\add* noblemen.
I myself I have commanded my consecrated ones,
I have also summoned my mighty warriors concerning my anger,
the ⸤ones who exalt over⸥\f + \fr 13:3 \ft Literally “exultant of” \f* my majesty.
A sound, a noise \add is\add* on the mountains,
\add the\add* likeness \add of\add* many people!
A sound of \add the\add* roar of \add the\add* kingdoms,
of nations gathering!
Yahweh of hosts \add is\add* mustering an army for battle.
\add They are\add* coming from a distant land,
from the end of the heavens,
Yahweh and the weapons of his indignation,
to destroy ⸤the whole earth⸥.\f + \fr 13:5 \ft Literally “all of the land/earth” \f*
Wail, for the day of Yahweh \add is\add* near;
it will come like destruction from Shaddai!\f + \fr 13:6 \ft Often translated “the Almighty” \f*
Therefore all hands will grow slack,
and every human heart will melt,
and they will be dismayed.
Pangs and labor pains will seize \add them\add*;
they will tremble like a woman giving birth.
⸤They will stare at one another⸥,\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Literally “A man will stare at his neighbor” \f*
⸤their faces flushing⸥.\f + \fr 13:8 \ft Literally “faces of flames” \f*
Look! The day of Yahweh \add is\add* coming,
cruel and wrath and \add the\add* burning \add of\add* anger,
to make the earth a desolation,
and he will destroy its sinners from it.
For the stars of the heavens and their constellations will not flash forth their light;
the sun will keep back when it comes out,
and \add the\add* moon will not cause its light to shine.
And I will punish \add the\add* world \add for its\add* evil
and \add the\add* wicked \add for\add* their iniquity.
And I will put an end to \add the\add* pride of \add the\add* arrogant,
and I will bring \add the\add* haughtiness of tyrants low.
I will make humanity more rare than gold
and humankind more than the gold of Ophir.
Therefore I will make \add the\add* heavens tremble,
and the earth will quake from its place
because of the wrath of Yahweh of hosts,
and in the day his anger burns.
And this shall happen:
like a hunted gazelle or sheep ⸤with none to gather them⸥,\f + \fr 13:14 \ft Literally “and without one who gathers” \f*
they will each turn to his \add own\add* people,
and they will each flee to his \add own\add* land.
Everyone who is found will be pierced through,
and everyone who is carried away will fall by the sword.
And their children will be dashed into pieces before their eyes;
their houses will be plundered, and their wives will be raped.\f + \fr 13:16 \ft The reading tradition (\fqa Qere \ft ) softens this to “slept with” \f*
Look! I \add am\add* stirring the Medes up against them,
who do not value silver
and do not delight in gold.
And \add their\add* bows will shatter young men.
And they will not show mercy on \add the\add* fruit of \add the\add* womb;
their eyes will not look compassionately on children.
And Babylon, \add the\add* glory of kingdoms, the splendor of the Chaldeans’ pride, will be like ⸤when God overthrew⸥\f + \fr 13:19 \ft Literally “the overthrow by God of” \f* Sodom and Gomorrah.
It will not be inhabited forever,
and it will not be dwelled in ⸤forever⸥;\f + \fr 13:20 \ft Literally “until generation and generation” \f*
and no Arab will pitch a tent there,
and shepherds will not allow \add their flocks\add* to lie down there.
But wild animals will lie down there,
and their houses will be full \add of\add* howling creatures,
and the daughters of ostriches\f + \fr 13:21 \ft Hebrew “ostrich” \f* will live there,
and goats will dance there.
And hyenas will answer in its palaces,
and jackals in the pleasure palaces;
and its time ⸤is coming soon⸥,\f + \fr 13:22 \ft Literally “close to come” \f*
and its days will not be prolonged.
